meanings.definition: The state or quality of being inconvenient or uncomfortable.
meanings.sent1: The incommodiousness of the small waiting room made passengers feel cramped.
meanings.sent2: The incommodiousness of the old bus seats made the long journey unbearable.
meanings.sent3: The incommodiousness of the tiny elevator led to some comical attempts at fitting everyone inside.
meanings.sent4: The incommodiousness of the situation was like trying to fit a square peg in a round hole.
meanings.sent5: The incommodiousness of the narrow hallway was a constant source of frustration for the residents.

meanings.definition: The condition of lacking space or being cramped.
meanings.sent1: The incommodiousness of the studio apartment made it challenging to move around.
meanings.sent2: The incommodiousness of the crowded subway during rush hour was overwhelming.
meanings.sent3: The incommodiousness of the tiny car led to some hilarious attempts at squeezing in.
meanings.sent4: The incommodiousness of the storage closet was like trying to fit a gallon into a pint-sized container.
meanings.sent5: The incommodiousness of the small tent made camping a less than comfortable experience.
